column4: hi! yesterday I installed a ubuntu via netinstall, but it won't boot. is there any way the re-write the Grub or MBR?
can you boot into any enviroment?
can I do it with the netinstall CD or do I need the live CD?
I have the netinstall image, but I haven't found grub there yet ;)
so you have no grub on the target machine at all? you could try booting a usb stick and installing grub with that
I don't know. I have the netinstall image. There must be a grub somewhere.. :-/
Since he installed without errors yesterday.
Maybe I just re-install?
Maybe I did set the boot-flag incorrect? Does this have to be at /boot or at / (root) or doesn't grub care where it is?
try manually installing grub after booting via pxe?
or does it not boot off pxe?
PXE is netboot, yes?
pxe is the standard for booting over the network
That's a very good idea. So I need to setup a PXE Env on an other machine?
well pxe booting is built into the network card
Does the machine boot off the network ok?
The BIOS has the option, but I never tried so far
http://mediakey.dk/~cc/ubuntu-netboot-and-netinstall-with-pxe/
ok I will give it a try C-S-B. Thank you :)

arent you trying to boot and install over the network though? In order to successfully boot off the network, you need to have a pxe enable gfx card, a server dishing out the image with a dhcp server running. :)
I manage a 2x system at work it's kind of similar :)
no I used a 8.10_Netinstall image from USB. :) sorry for the mix-up in terms.
